revised_title: Bright Lines in the Spectra of Stars and Nebulae
tldr: The author discusses the presence of bright lines in the spectra of stars and nebulae, suggesting that these lines may indicate a large coronal atmosphere around the stars. He encourages others with more advanced optical equipment to search for these lines and provides guidance on how to do so. The author also briefly touches on the concept of the "facility of production" of chemical substances and its relation to mathematical laws of combination.
